input.label: Today's date

Hello, my name is _____, and I am a researcher with IPSOS. Today, we are conducting a study to better understand the value of Hygeia Community Health Care to its members. Our survey will focus on the costs of managing hypertension. Hygeia provided us your contact information and suggested that we interview you for this research. We would like to invite you to participate in this study, which will last approximately one hour. Any information you provide will be confidential and will be used only for this research. Your participation is entirely voluntary and you can refuse to partcipate if you wish. If you are not comfortable with any question, you may choose not to answer it. Also, please feel free to ask any question at any time. Thank you in advance for your participation and cooperation. If you agree to be interviewed, can we begin now?
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

select1.label: Did the person give consent?

input.label: Surveyor's name
Location of survey
Eligibility: First, I am going to ask a few questions to make sure you will be able to answer the survey.

select1.label: Do you have hypertension?
select1.hint: If No, STOP SURVEY.

select1.label: Have you seen a doctor or taken drugs for your hypertension at some point in the last 12 months?
select1.hint: If No, STOP SURVEY.

select1.label: Are you registered with Hygeia?
select1.hint: If No, STOP SURVEY.

select1.label: Do you have any type of health insurance?
select1.hint: If YES, stop survey. If NO, restart with UNINSURED SURVEY.

input.label: SECTION A: First, I'm going to ask some basic questions about you and your household.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

input.label: 1.a Respondent's first name
1.b Respondent's last name
1.c Age

select1.label: 1.d Sex
1.e Marital Status
2.a Are you the family member who first registered with Hygeia?
2.b If No, who in your family enrolled with Hygeia?

input.label: 2.b.1 Please specify your relationship to the person who enrolled with Hygeia.
2.d When did you enroll with Hygeia? (month)
input.hint: If the respondent does not know, please leave this question blank.

input.label: 2.d When did you enroll with Hygeia? (year)
input.hint: If the respondent does not know, please leave this question blank.

select1.label: 3. Are you the head of your household?

input.label: 4.a How many adults under 65 live in your household?
input.hint: (including respondent, if he or she is in this age bracket)

input.label: 4.b How many adults over 65 live in your household?
input.hint: (including respondent, if he or she is in this age bracket)

input.label: 4.c How many children under 18 live in your household?

select1.label: 5. Has any member of the household migrated to another city or country?

input.label: 5.a If Yes, how many household members have migrated?
SECTION B: Next, I'm going to ask a few questions about your home, your work and how you manage your money.
input.hint: Read this to respondent.

input.label: 6. How many years did you attend school?

select1.label: 7.a Do you own or rent your home?

input.label: 7.a.1 Please specify other:

select.label: 7.b In your household, do you have…
select.hint: Read each item individually and check all that apply.

select1.label: 8. Are you currently working and earning income?

select.label: 8.a If No, are you a homemaker, a student, or retired?
8.b If Yes, Are you an employee, a day worker or a business owner?
select.hint: An employee is paid regularly by a boss or company. A day worker is paid by a person who hires him or her to perform a service for the day or other limited period. A business owner earns income from his or her services or sales.

select.label: 8.c What type of work do you do?
select.hint: Listen to respondent's answer and choose all categories that apply.

input.label: 8.c.1 Please specify what type of work you do.
8.c.2 Tell me a little bit more about your work.
input.hint: (type of shop or service)

input.label: 9.a How many days per week do you work, on average?

select1.label: 9.b How do you earn money?
select1.hint: A daily or hourly wage is paid by a boss. A fee for service is a flat rate for a service (bike repair, dressmaking, etc.). Profits from sales are the income earned by selling items for a higher price than they were purchased.

item.label: Daily wage or fee for service

input.label: 9.c How much money do you typically earn in a day?
9.d.1 How much do you typically sell each day?
9.d.2 How much do you spend to buy the goods that you sell each day?
So, your profit is about per day.
So, in a typical month, you make about naira.
So, in a typical month, you make about naira.

select1.label: Does that sound right?
select1.hint: If no, ask the respondent to help you correct the daily wage from before.

input.label: 9.e How many days per week did you work before you had hypertension, on average?
9.f How much money did you earn in a typical day before you had hypertension?
So, before you had hypertension, you made about naira in a typical month.

select1.label: Does that sound right?
select1.hint: If no, ask the respondent to help you correct the daily wage from before.

select1.label: 10. Are you the main source of income in your household?
10.a Who earns most of the income for your household?

input.label: 10.a.1 Please specify who earns most of the income for your household.

select.label: 10.b What is the main source of income for your household?

input.label: 10.b.1 Please specify what type of work that person does.
10.c What is the approximate monthly income earned by all the other members living in your household, NOT including your own?
input.hint: If the respondent gives you a yearly estimate, please divide by 12 months. If respondent gives you a weekly estimate, please multiply by 4 weeks. If respondent gives you a daily income, multiply by the number of days they work each month.

select1.label: 11.a Do you receive money on a regular basis from family members who live outside Lagos?

input.label: 11.a.1 if Yes, How much money do these family members send you each month?
input.hint: If the respondent gives you a yearly estimate, please divide by 12 months. If respondent gives you a weekly estimate, please multiply by 4 weeks. If respondent gives you a daily income, multiply by the number of days they work each month.

input.label: So, including your income, your family's income, and money you receive from outside, your household's total monthly income is naira.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

input.label: So, including your income, your family's income, and money you receive from outside, your household's total monthly income is naira.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

select1.label: Does that sound right?
select1.hint: If no, ask the respondent to help you correct the income numbers from questions 9 through 11.

input.label: Now, I am going to ask you about your routine household expenses.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

input.label: 12.a How much does your household spend each month on food?
12.b How much does your household spend each month on schooling?
input.hint: If the respondent reports an annual school fee, divide this by 12.

input.label: 12.c How much does your household spend in a typical month on health care (NOT including the health insurance premium)?
input.hint: Surveyor, it may help to ask about the number of doctors' visits in a year, calculate this annual cost, and divide by 12.

input.label: 12.d How much does your household spend each month on rent and utilities?
12.e How much does your household spend each month on transport?
12.f How much does your household spend each month on loan payments?
12.g How much does your household spend each month on entertainment, alcohol or cigarettes?
12.h How much does your household spend each month on everything else?
In total, your monthly household expenses are about .
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

select1.label: Does that sound right?
select1.hint: If no, ask the respondent to help you correct the expense numbers from question 12.

input.label: Next, I will ask about how you manage your money.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

select1.label: 13.a Do you have any outstanding loans from banks, microfinance institutions or cooperative societies?

input.label: 13.a.1 How many loans do you have?
Let's talk about one loan at a time. First, let me ask about the first loan.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

input.label: How much did you borrow?
How much is still outstanding?
What is the term of the loan (in months)?
What is the interest rate per month?
How much do you pay back each month?
Now, I'll ask about the second loan. How much did you borrow?
How much is still outstanding?
What is the term of the loan (in months)?
What is the interest rate per month?
How much do you pay back each month?

select1.label: 13.b Do you have any outstanding loans from friends or family, bosses, suppliers, thrifts or moneylenders?

input.label: 13.b.1 How many of these types of loans do you have?
Let's talk about one loan at a time. First, let me ask about the first loan.
How much did you borrow?
How much is still outstanding?
What is the term of the loan (in months)?
What is the interest rate per month?
How much do you pay back each month?
Now, I'll ask about the second loan. How much did you borrow?
How much is still outstanding?
What is the term of the loan (in months)?
What is the interest rate per month?
How much do you pay back each month?

select.label: 14.a Which of the following sources do you borrow from regularly?
select.hint: Please mark all those that apply.

input.label: 14.a.1 Please specify another borrowing source.

select.label: 14.b Of all the sources I just mentioned, which are the cheapest?
select.hint: Please mark up to two responses.

input.label: 14.b.1 Please specify another cheap borrowing source.

select.label: 14.c What are the most important factors to consider when taking out a loan?
select.hint: Allow respondent to answer freely, and choose the options that most closely resemble the response.

item.label: Time period to pay it back
Access to insurance through a loan

input.label: 14.c.1 Please specify another important factor.

select1.label: 15.a Do you have a savings account?

select.label: 15.a.1 With what type of institution(s) do you have your savings account?

input.label: Please specify the type of institution where you have a savings account.

select1.label: 15.a.2 Are any of your savings accounts compulsory?

input.label: 15.a.3 How much money do you currently have in your savings account(s)?

select1.label: 15.b Do you save anywhere else, such as with a group of friends, at home or in another safe place?

select.label: 15.b.1 If Yes, where?

input.label: Please specify where you save.
15.b.2 How much money do you have saved there?

select1.label: 16. Do you have any type of insurance, other than health?

select.label: 16.b What type of insurance do you have?
select.hint: Surveyor, please read all options and mark all that apply.

input.label: 16.b.1 Please specify the other type of insurance.
SECTION C: Now, I am going to ask you some questions about your hypertension.
input.hint: Please read this to respondent.

input.label: 17.a When did you find out that you have hypertension? (year)
17.a When did you find out that you have hypertension? (month)
input.hint: 1=January, 2=February, etc.

select1.label: 17.a.1 Did you learn about this condition before or after you enrolled with Hygeia?
17.b How did you find out that you have hypertension?

input.label: 17.b If "Other," please specify how you found out that you have hypertension.

select1.label: 17.c Before you knew you had hypertension, did you experience any symptoms?

select.label: 17.c.1 What symptoms did you experience?
select.hint: Allow the respondent to answer freely, and select the responses that are closest.

input.label: 17.c.1 If "Other," please specify what other symptoms you had.
17.d How long after experiencing these symptoms did you wait before you consulted a doctor?

select1.label: 17.d Please specify days, weeks or months.

select.label: 17.d.1 If you waited over three months, why?
select.hint: Skip this question if the respondent waited 3 months or less. Allow respondent to answer freely and select all that apply.

item.label: Did not think I needed to

input.label: 17.d.1 If "Other," please specify why you waited before seeing a doctor.

select.label: 17.d.2 Before you saw the doctor, did you do anything else in the meantime?
select.hint: Skip this question if the respondent waited 3 months or less. Allow respondent to answer freely and select all that apply.

input.label: 17.d.2 If "Other," please specify what you did in the meantime.
Now, I am going to ask you how you have managed your hypertension in the last year, and how much that has cost you.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

input.label: First, I am going to ask you about any drugs you take for your hypertension.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

select1.label: 18. Do you take drugs for your hypertension?

input.label: 18.a If so, how many different types of drugs do you take?
18.b What is the name(s) of your drugs?

select1.label: 18.c Who prescribed these drugs?

input.label: 18.c.1 If "Other," please specify who prescribed these drugs.
18.d.1 How many times per week did they say you should take it?
18.d.2 How many times per week do you usually take it?

select1.label: 18.e Did you miss any dosages in the last three months?

input.label: 18.e.1 If Yes, how many doses did you miss?

select1.label: 18.e.2 If Yes, why did you miss?

item.label: Bad side effects/drugs made me feel sick

input.label: 18.e.2 If Other, please specify the reason why you missed your dose.

select.label: 18.f Where do you get these drugs?
select.hint: Allow the respondent to answer freely, and select the responses that are closest.

input.label: 18.f.1 If "Other," please specify where you get these drugs.

select1.label: 18.g.1 Do you pay cash money for any of these drugs, without the help of Hygeia?

input.label: 18.g.2 About how much do you pay each month on hypertension drugs?
input.hint: If the respondent offers a per pill or a per week cost, help them estimate a monthly cost.

input.label: So, you spend around naira on drugs each year.

select1.label: Does that sound right?
select1.hint: If no, ask the respondent to help you correct the expense numbers from question 12.

input.label: Now, I am going to ask you about trips to health facilities to monitor or treat your hypertension.

select1.label: 19.a Did you visit a clinic or hospital for your hypertension in the last 3 months?
select1.hint: Surveyor may use a calendar to aid recall.

input.label: 19.a.1 How many times did you go in the last 3 months?
input.hint: Surveyor may use a calendar to aid recall.

select1.label: 19.b Did you visit a clinic or hospital for your hypertension in the last 12 months?
select1.hint: Surveyor may use a calendar to aid recall.

input.label: 19.b.1 How many times did you go in the last 12 months?
input.hint: Surveyor may use a calendar to aid recall. Include visits from the last 3 months.

select1.label: 19.c Do you always go to the same clinic or hospital?

input.label: Now, I would like to ask you about your last visit in particular.
20.a When was your last visit? (month)
input.hint: 1=January, 2=February, etc.

select1.label: 20.b What type of facility did you visit?

input.label: 20.b If "Other," please specify the type of facility you visited.

select.label: 20.c What type of health provider did you see?

input.label: If "Other," please specify the type of health provider you saw.

select1.label: 20.c.1 Was he/she the same provider you had seen before?

select.label: 20.d Why did you choose this facility?

item.label: I was told by Hygeia to visit this facility.
Hygeia gave me a list of clinics and I chose this one.
I have always visited this facility.
It is close to my home/work.
It was recommended to me by family/friend
I can have tests completed there

input.label: If "Other," please specify why you chose this facility.
input.hint: Allow the respondent to answer freely, and select the responses that are closest.

select.label: 20.e If you were not enrolled in Hygeia, where would you have gone instead?

item.label: A private clinic that is cheaper
A private clinic that is closer to home/work
A friend with a blood pressure monitor
I would not have sought any care.

input.label: 20.e If "Other," please specify where else you would have gone.
Next, I'm going to ask you about the quality of care you received at the facility.
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

input.label: 21. For the following questions, how would you rate the quality of services you received at the facility?
input.hint: Please read this to the respondent.

select1.label: Knowledge about your medical history
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Courtesy and attention from the nurse or doctor
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Courtesy and attention from administrative staff
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Waiting time before seeing the doctor
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Cleanliness of the facility
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Availability and condition of medical equipment
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Availability of medicine and supplies
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Access to lab tests on site
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: Quick and clear processing of payment
select1.hint: Please read ALL the indicators below and mark ONE response per indicator.

select1.label: 22. Describe your perception of how the staff treated you at the facility.
select1.hint: Please read the options and mark one that applies.

item.label: I was treated better than other patients because of my insurance
I was treated worse than other patients because of my insurance.
I was treated like all other patients in the facility.

input.label: 22. If "Other," please explain.
Now, I am going to ask you about any costs you paid with cash money at the facility, without the help from Hygeia.

select1.label: 24. Did you pay a consultation/doctor's fee?

input.label: 24.a How much was that fee?

select1.label: 25. Did you pay for any lab tests?

input.label: 25.a How much did you pay for lab tests?

select1.label: 26. Did you pay for anything else at the facility, other than drugs?
select1.hint: Please ensure that the respondent does not include the cost of medication.

input.label: 26.a What was it for?
26.b How much did you pay?
So, you paid naira at the facility, not including drugs.

select1.label: Does that sound right?
select1.hint: If no, ask the respondent to help you correct the cost numbers.

input.label: Now, I am going to ask about any other costs you incurred because you attended this visit.

select1.label: 27. Did you pay for your own transport to and from the facility?

input.label: 27.a How much did you pay for your transport?

select1.label: 28. Did a household member accompany you to and from the facility?

input.label: 28.a How much did that person pay for transport?

select1.label: 29. Did you have to miss work to go to the facility?

input.label: 29.a If Yes, how many hours did you miss?
29.b How much money do you usually make per hour?
input.hint: Sales minus cost of goods sold

select1.label: 29.c Did you hire anyone to replace you during that time?

input.label: 29.c.1 If Yes, how much did you pay them per hour?

select1.label: 29.c.2 Did they sell as much as you would have sold during the same time?
30. Did anyone else in your household miss work to take you to the visit?

input.label: 30.a How many hours of work did this person miss?
30.b How much money does that person usually make per hour?
input.hint: If this person did not lose any income, please write 0.

input.label: So, with in costs at the facility, of transportation costs, of hired worker costs and of lost income, the total cost of this visit was .

select1.label: 31. Do you agree with this total?

input.label: 31.a If not, what was the rough total cost in naira?
If you spent on one visit, and you had visits last year, you spent around last year on health facility visits.

select1.label: Does that sound right?
select1.hint: If no, ask the respondent to help you correct the cost numbers.

input.label: Now, I am going to ask you about any blood pressure checks or other tests you got OUTSIDE of a clinic or hospital.

select1.label: Did you get any blood pressure checks or other tests OUTSIDE of a clinic or hospital in the past 3 months?

input.label: How many times have you gotten testing outside of a clinic or hospital in the last 3 months?

select1.label: Did you get any blood pressure checks or other tests OUTSIDE of a clinic or hospital in the past 12 months?

input.label: How many times have you gotten testing outside of a clinic or hospital in the last 12 months?

select.label: Where do you go to get the test?

input.label: If "Other," please specify where you go to get the test.

select1.label: Did you have to pay money for this test?

input.label: If Yes, how much did you have to pay per test?

select1.label: Did you have to pay transport to get to the test location?

input.label: If Yes, how much did you pay for transport?

select1.label: Did you miss work to get to the test location?

input.label: If Yes, how many hours of work did you miss?

select1.label: Have you bought a home blood pressure monitor in the last 12 months?

input.label: If Yes, how much did you pay for the blood pressure monitor?
Now, I am going to ask you about any changes you have made in your everyday life to manage your hypertension in the last 12 months.

select.label: Have you made any of the following changes to your lifestyle in the last 12 months?

input.label: Please specify any other lifestyle changes you have made in the last 12 months.

select.label: If Yes, why did you make these changes?
select.hint: Skip if the respondent made no changes.

item.label: Heard about it on radio or TV

input.label: If "Other," please specify why you made these changes.
What type of exercise do you do?
For how many months of this past year have you kept this exercise routine?
input.hint: Maximum = 12 months

input.label: How many minutes per day do you exercise now?
How many minutes per day did you exercise before you began this new routine?

select1.label: Does it cost you any money to exercise?

input.label: If Yes, how much does it cost you per week?

select1.label: Does it save you any money to exercise more?

input.label: If Yes, how much money does exercising save you each week?

select.label: What types of changes have you made to your diet?

item.label: Eating less fried and fast food

input.label: If "Other," please specify the changes you have made to your diet.
For how many months of this past year have you eaten a different diet?
Now, I am going to ask you about all the meals you have eaten in the last 24 hours. (your last 3 meals)
Out of those 3 meals, how many were fried or fast food?
Out of those 3 meals, how many were cooked at home?
Out of those 3 meals, how many did you add salt to after they were prepared?
Out of those 3 meals, how many had fresh fruits or vegetables?
Now, I am going to ask you about what you ate in a typical day before you changed your diet. (3 meals)
Before you changed your diet, how many of your daily meals were fried or fast food?
Before you changed your diet, how many of your daily meals were prepared at home?
Before you changed your diet, how many of your daily meals did you add salt to after they were prepared?
Before you changed your diet, how many of your daily meals had fresh fruits or vegetables?

select1.label: Do you spend more on food now than you did before you changed your diet?

input.label: If Yes, how much more do you spend per week on food?

select1.label: Do you spend less on food now than you did before you changed your diet?

input.label: If Yes, how much less do you spend per week on food?
For how many months of this past year have you reduced your alcohol consumption?
How many alcoholic drinks do you consume each day?
How many alcoholic drinks did you consume before you changed your drinking habits?

select1.label: Has it cost you any money to cut your alcohol consumption?

input.label: If Yes, how much does it cost you per week?

select1.label: Has it saved you any money to cut your alcohol consumption?

input.label: If Yes, how much has it saved you per week?
For how many months of this past year have you reduced or stopped smoking?
How many cigarettes do you smoke each day?
How many cigarettes did you smoke each day before you changed your smoking habits?

select1.label: Has it cost you any money to smoke less or to quit smoking?

input.label: If Yes, how much does it cost you per week?

select1.label: Has it saved you any money to smoke less or to quit smoking?

input.label: If Yes, how much has it saved you per week?
For how many months of this past year have you reduced the number of hours you work?
How many hours do you work in a day?
How many hours did you work per day before you made this change?
How much do you usually make in an hour?

select1.label: How would you rate your level of stress from family or money problems on a day-to-day basis?
How would you rate your level of stress from family or money problems on a day-to-day basis before you made this change?

input.label: How many hours do you sleep per night?
How many hours did you sleep each night before you made this change?
In the last year, you have spent on lifestyle changes.
In the last year, you have saved because of your lifestyle changes.
